description: General information describing an endpoint
A unique proper name or character sequence that identifies this particular person. In Beacon v2: id, in FAIR Genomes: PersonalIdentifier. In RD3: subjectID. In JRC-CDE: Pseudonym
This row is an instance of one or more of these class(es) other than the Endpoint table.
A name given to the resource.
An account of the resource.
An entity responsible for making the resource available.
A language of the resource.
A legal document giving official permission to do something with the resource.
An established standard to which the described resource conforms.
Information about rights held in and over the resource.
Information about who access the resource or an indication of its security status.
Relevant contact information for the catalogued resource. Use of vCard is recommended.
A keyword or tag describing a resource.
A main category of the resource. A resource can have multiple themes.
The root location or primary endpoint of the service (a web-resolvable IRI).
A description of the service end-point, including its operations, parameters etc.
Identifier of the metadata entry.
With the definition of the FDP as a type of metadata service that serves metadata catalogs, the relation between the Metadata Service and dcat:Catalog is represented by this predicate.
Name of the organisation. E.g. University Medical Center Groningen
Alternative endpoint URL.

Set to true if the resource onboarded to the EJP-RD Virtual Platform contains personal data, personal data meaning data related to identified or identifiable persons (as per GDPR definition), otherwise false.
This property must be attached to every entity that you wish the EJP-RD Virtual Platform to explore.
